definition: to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: I smile, when you face the habit.
sentences.chinese: 強顏歡笑，是莪面對妳時旳習慣。

sentences.english: She swallowed her displeasure and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 她抑制我自己的不快，強顏歡笑。

sentences.english: The poor girl disguised her sorrow beneath a cheerful appearance.
sentences.chinese: 可憐的姑娘以強顏歡笑來掩飾悲傷。

sentences.english: You again how boethius observed all still could not return to the origin.
sentences.chinese: 你再怎麼強顏歡笑縡一切都還是回不到原點。

sentences.english: You again how boethius observed all still could not return to the origin.
sentences.chinese: 你再怎麼強顏歡笑乬一切都還是回不到原點。

sentences.english: The team is putting on a happy face now.
sentences.chinese: 這支隊伍正在強顏歡笑。

sentences.english: I can only smile, to pay homage to my unknown injury.
sentences.chinese: 我只能用強顏歡笑，來祭奠我不明的傷。

sentences.english: I did my best to smile, and vowed to never again cycle nearly a hundred miles in a day.
sentences.chinese: 我強顏歡笑，發誓以後再也不能一天騎一百英里了。

sentences.english: From then on, Marguerite tried to appear more cheerful. There were no more tears.
sentences.chinese: 從這時起，瑪格麗特強顏歡笑，她不再哭了。

sentences.english: Force a smile is now I have not had a chance to take off the mask.
sentences.chinese: 強顏歡笑現已是我沒有機會摘掉的面具。

sentences.english: Their faces are strained, even in moments of forced and vulgar laughter.
sentences.chinese: 他們神色緊張，強顏歡笑時也是如此。

definition: to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
